body.p: A recent article on the Gentoo 2004.3 and 2005.0 releases contained a few errors to which quite a few Gentoo users and developers reacted. Chris Gianelloni has worked together with the ZDNet folks to fix all inaccuracies. We would like to thank ZDNet UK for their quick response in this matter.

Chris Gianelloni, who leads the Gentoo Release Engineering Project, informs us in this article that the 2005.0 release will provide a Minimal, Universal and Package CD, but that an experimental LiveCD will be released for the AMD64 and x86 architectures containing a more Knoppix-like environment.

The article also mentions the continuous development efforts of the Gentoo Linux Installer Project, aiming for a diverse set of install options, ranging from a graphical installation tool to the possibility of performing an unattended installation.
